channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2024110289
item.description:
Report X-2024110289

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Outer packaging is wet from another leaking pkg. Inspection found inner pkg with Ltd Qty diamonds printed on carton. Mfg. SDS advises contents can be shipped as Ltd Qty but there were no markings on the outer carton indicating Hazardous Materials inside pkg. Pressurized contents will be repacked as prescribed.

item.title: Report X-2024110340
item.description:
Report X-2024110340

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: EAST GRANBY
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered torn/damaged during offload operations. Inner contents: Dry Ice and a DNA sample. The Dry Ice escaped the outer packaging and spilled inside of a ULD. The package is being held for shipper disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024110049
item.description:
Report E-2024110049

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-03
  • City: BRIDGEPORT
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2100 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XBP. It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of BYK-A 501 SG was released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 35. ERTS reviewed with the caller that they need to call DERTS before starting any cleanup activities on-site. Called Chemtrec and spoke to Mona. Report #2024100300255. Connecticut Dept. of Environmental Protection: 860-424-3338 spoke to Mark 223 Report #202402914. Metal drum containerized into a 65-gallon metal drum along with oil dri.
